intro: Echidnopsis seibanica, commonly known as the seibanica milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a distinctive tubular shape. Its leaves are usually opposite and ovate, with a slightly hairy texture. Echidnopsis seibanica is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions.
